location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from John Shore, Secretary of the Marine Board, Fort William, Calcutta

physicalDescription.extent: Condition: The item has suffered from pest damage and as a result the opening section of the letter is difficult to read.

mods.abstract: The letter concerns goods that have been landed in Bushire and instructions concerning modifications that are to be made to the vessel Varuna, which is to be made ready to sail by 1 December 1806. It also outlines the terms and conditions for the possible use of the ship by the East India Company.The intended recipient of the letter is unknown.Includes one enclosure; a notice from R Dennison the owner and commander of the Varunawhich signals his acceptance of the terms of the East India Company for the modification and use of his ship by said company.
